description.value:
You call forth a bestial spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the Bestial Spirit stat block. When you cast the spell, choose an environment: Air, Land, or Water. The creature resembles an animal of your choice that is native to the chosen environment, which determines certain traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.actors.Actor.MLAIS1lRNPUIqElC]{Bestial Spirit - Air}

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.actors.Actor.DBiGdR6nNl3DQ04b]{Bestial Spirit - Land}

@UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.actors.Actor.L9AO8pAaoninCJMv]{Bestial Spirit - Water}

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the beast acts during your turn. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you do not issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell's level appears in the stat block.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level or higher, grants a duration that does not require concentration.

materials.value: a feather, tuft of fur, and fish tail inside a gilded acorn worth at least 100 gp
